pullRequest.title: feat: Adds table scans to pull queries
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
This PR adds the ability to table scan to pull queries.  Currently, projections work with them, though currently, nothing is supported in the where clause.  This should come later.  It's disabled by default, but can be enabled with the config ksql.query.pull.table.scan.enabled.
I didn't add any documentation yet because this should be considered an experimental change with limited functionality.  Benchmarking and where clause support are required before this should be considered a non experimental.
A table scan is issued like:
select * from RATINGS_TABLE;

Testing done
Unit tests + RQTT + manual testing
Reviewer checklist

 Ensure docs are updated if necessary. (eg. if a user visible feature is being added or changed).
 Ensure relevant issues are linked (description should include text like "Fixes #")

nodes.bodyText: Can we please add Javadocs for this class? It's getting more and more complex and for a first-timer looking at it, it's impossible to figure out what the purpose of the class is, what the algorithm is and what the methods and data structures represent
We should add tests in KsLocatorTest to make sure that the data structures are populated correctly with all active and standby partitions the underlying store has
What's the purpose of this iterator? Why do we need a special class? I see that this is used to close the iterator? Aren't iterators closed when done automatically?

commit.message: feat: Adds table scans to pull queries
Deletes whereinfo change since it's not necessary
Refactors to not use KeyQueryMetadata everywhere

beforeCommit.message: Deletes whereinfo change since it's not necessary

commit.message: Fix warning, reworked some locator code
Get old message back for tests
